etymology.description: 我(我) (wǒ, "I"), 知(知) (zhī, "know"), 道(道) (dào, "way; path; to speak")
etymology.interpretation: The phrase combines 我(我) (wǒ, "I") with 知道(知道) (zhīdào, "know") which itself consists of 知(知) meaning "know" and 道(道) which in this context acts as a complement to intensify the meaning of knowing or recognizing something. This phrase simply means "I know".

examples.chinese: 他告诉我事实(他告訴我事實)，我知道真相(我知道真相)。
examples.pinyin: Tā gàosù wǒ shìshí, wǒ zhīdào zhēnxiàng.
examples.english: He told me the facts, I know the truth.

examples.chinese: 当你说完(當你說完)，我知道(我知道)。
examples.pinyin: Dāng nǐ shuō wán, wǒ zhīdào.
examples.english: When you finish speaking, I know.
